summary: To obtain a position that will provide me with the necessary tools in order for me to provide excellent customer service. One that will allow room for advancement and continued educational training.

experience.title: Customer Service Agent
experience.description: Answering phones; Discussing patient accounts; Providing assistance to patients with their bills; Reading EOBs to provide information; Collecting payments; Scheduling payment plans for large balance accounts; Updating patient information in Allegra; Changing strategies on accounts; Updating insurance information; Scheduling claims to be sent; Printing and mailing documents (Financial Assistance Forms, Itemized Bills, Statements, & Receipts); Faxing documents; All other duties as assigned by management.

experience.title: File Clerk
experience.description: Sorting & prepping paper Employee Files; Accurately removing confidential patient information from all Employee files prior to scanning and indexing; Working a daily Onbase Workflow report to ensure applications and background check information are properly scanned and indexed; Scanning and indexing supporting I-9 documents; Manual entry of I-9 information into Heat; Prepping and sorting education assistance documentation prior to scanning; Uploading & indexing documents sent via e-mail to the Medical Records online queue.

experience.title: DME Billing Specialist
experience.description: Obtaining evidence of Durable Medical Equipment dispensed; Billing charges for equipment to the patient and/or insurance company; Reading doctor/surgical notes to locate and apply the appropriate ICD-9 code; Locating ABN and other documentation scanned into the patient’s medical chart for Medicare billing; Maintaining deadlines and timely filing limits; Researched CPT and ICD-9 coding discrepancies for compliance and reimbursement accuracy; Maintaining strict patient and physician confidentiality.

experience.title: Billing Document Specialist
experience.description: Data entry of orders for Durable Medical Equipment; Applying the correct ICD-9 code; Dispatching calls within the facility using Alcatel overhead paging and phones; Assisting patients with questions about equipment delivery and other services; Assisting walk-in patients with pickup/return of equipment; Created Letters and Certificates of Medical Necessity for Durable Medical and Respiratory Equipment; Contacted Physicians’ Offices to obtain documentation for billing; Searched database for diagnosis codes, ABNs, and signed orders to support insurance billing.

education.degree: AAS in Medical Billing & Coding Reimbursement
